content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are extremely comfortable taking risks and are always ready to embrace new challenges, even if they involve significant uncertainty or potential loss. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 40$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 40$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 20$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose strategy that maximizes my overall earnings given my risk-taking nature. In this game, if both players consistently pick the same move (either R or B), one player will always lose out on potential earnings. Since I am comfortable with taking risks, I will try to exploit this by using a mix of strategies to increase my chances of earning more than the opponent over the long run.

Let's analyze the possible outcomes:
1. If both players choose R in every round, they each get 45$ per round for 75 rounds, totaling 3375$.
2. If both players choose B in every round, they each get 20$ per round for 75 rounds, totaling 1500$.
3. If one player chooses R and the other chooses B in all 75 rounds, the player choosing R gets 0$ while the opponent gets 40$ for 75 rounds, totaling 3000$, but the player choosing R only earns 0$ throughout the game.
4. If one player consistently switches between R and B while the other maintains a constant strategy (either R or B), the switcher has more chances of earning more over the long run.

Since I'm aiming to maximize my earnings, I will adopt a mixed strategy where I switch between R and B randomly in each round, ensuring that I have a higher chance of exploiting an opponent who consistently chooses the same move. By doing so, I can potentially earn more than 1500$ while still having a non-zero probability of earning more than 3000$.

So, my choice would be to randomly switch between R and B in each round, appending my choice letter as {R} or {B} depending on the selected strategy for that particular round.
You chose B. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 40$. Your opponent's payoff is 0$. Please play the next round.

I will choose R for this round, appending my choice letter as {R}. This way, if my opponent continues to stick with their initial choice of R, I can earn 45$ for each of the remaining rounds while they get 0$. However, it's essential to remember that a mixed strategy is more effective in the long run. In this scenario, I have just earned 40$, which is a positive outcome compared to the previous round where I would have earned nothing had I chosen R initially. If my opponent decides to switch strategies, I may still be able to capitalize on their change and earn even more over the remaining rounds.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In this case, I will choose B for the next round, appending my choice letter as {B}. If both players continue with their current strategies, we each get 20$ per round for the remaining rounds, totaling 1500$ each over 75 rounds. Since both players earned the same amount in this particular scenario, I believe that it is more beneficial to maintain a mixed strategy to keep my opponent guessing and potentially exploit any inconsistency or change in their strategies. By adopting a mix of R and B moves, I can increase my chances of earning more than 1500$ over the long run and maximize my overall earnings while keeping my risk-taking nature satisfied.
You chose B. Your opponent chose B. Your payoff is 20$. Your opponent's payoff is 20$. Please play the next round.

Given that both players are currently choosing the same move (B), I will switch my strategy for the next round by choosing R, appending my choice letter as {R}. If my opponent continues to choose B, I can earn 45$ in the next round while they get 0$. However, it is important to remember that maintaining a mixed strategy over the long run will help maximize my overall earnings. In this scenario, both players are currently earning the minimum payoff of 20$, and by switching strategies, I may be able to capitalize on any inconsistency or change in my opponent's strategies in the future rounds, ultimately increasing my chances of earning more over the entire game.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

In this case, since both players have chosen R in the previous rounds and are currently earning 45$ each per round, I will maintain my current strategy of choosing R for the next round, appending my choice letter as {R}. If both players continue with their current strategies, we each get 45$ per round for the remaining rounds, totaling 3375$ each over 75 rounds.

While it might seem tempting to switch strategies to potentially earn more, maintaining a consistent R strategy in this scenario ensures that I continue to receive the maximum payoff of 45$ per round as long as my opponent sticks with their current choice of R. Since both players are earning the same amount, there is no obvious advantage for either player to change their strategies. Nevertheless, I would still recommend maintaining a mixed strategy over the long run to increase the chances of exploiting any inconsistency or change in my opponent's strategies in future games or similar situations.
